channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 3 biggest passive-investing myths Goldman Sachs says investors need to get over
item.description: Over the years, passive investing has been accused of being “worse than Marxism,” and of leaving markets “fundamentally broken.”

item.title: ‘I became very frugal’: My husband and I are 40. I have $200,000 in student debt, while he has $600,000 in retirement savings. Are we in trouble?
item.description: “Neither of us will have an inheritance and everything we have, we built together.”

item.title: AstraZeneca sheds £15 billion of market cap as weight-loss-pill data underwhelms investors
item.description: AstraZeneca PLC shed £15 billion in market capitalization on Tuesday, after investors were underwhelmed by early data from a trial of a weight-loss pi...

item.title: Falling Rates, Rising Tax Risk Give Some Shine to Muni Bonds
item.description: Municipal bond issuance in the U.S. is heating up as local governments ramp up borrowing and investors gobble up the low-risk securities..

item.title: Stocks Rise as U.S. Election Day Starts
item.description: Major indexes crept higher as U.S. voters headed to the polls to elect their next president.

item.title: My wife, 50, has terminal cancer. Our estate is worth $18 million. How do we prepare?
item.description: “We have two children ages 19 and 21, with one starting law school and the younger planning on medical school.”

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Little Changed
item.description: Natural gas futures were little changed, edging higher with some support from an expected rise in heating demand and a pickup in LNG feedgas flows.

item.title: Sterling Might Outperform After Overdone Post-Budget Falls
item.description: The dollar weakened further after the U.S. trade deficit widened, as expected. Meanwhile, Monex Europe says sterling might outperform.

item.title: If you’re rich and 59, the new 401(k) ‘super catch-up’ may be for you
item.description: The IRS rule starting in 2025 allows people ages 60 to 63 to add $11,250 extra to their 401(k).

item.title: Gold Futures Remain Steady as Market Braces for U.S. Election Result
item.description: Gold investors are holding steady as the market focuses on the U.S. presidential election.
